page.title: 12Wetwang,Sledmere Monument
page.content:
In the top righr hand corner of this area is the Sledmere Monument built in 1867 in memory of Sir Tatton Sykes and paid for by the workers on his estate to show how much they liked him.
It can be seen for miles around as it stands 60 feet high and the view from here is one of the best in the area.On a clear day you can see Beverley Minster and as far as all the buildings on the Humber.
The monument has carvings on it that show Sir Tatton and a message to say how much he was appreciated.He paid for the church to be repaired and for our school to be built.
